thread.title: Philosopher (from the series On Death II)
thread.title_full: Philosopher (from the series On Death II)

title: Philosopher (from the series On Death II)
text:
Philosopher (from the series On Death II) Artist: Max Klinger (German, Leipzig 1857–1920 Großjena) Date: Etching and aquatint Dimensions: Plate: 19 1/2 × 13 5/16 in. (49.5 × 33.8 cm) Sheet: 21 15/16 × 15 13/16 in. (55.8 × 40.1 cm) Classification: Gift of Dr. F. H. Hirschland, 1952 Accession Number: Philosoph (from the series Vom Tode Zweiter Teil) Provenance Franz H. Hirschland; Donor: Franz H. Hirschland Catalogue Raisonné Singer 232 References Hans Wolfgang Singer Max Klinger: Radierungen, Stiche und Steindrucke. . Berlin, 1909, no. 232 (as "not yet completed"). Timeline of Art History (2000-present) 
Timelines Design for a Title Page for Sheet Music Artist: Max Klinger (German, Leipzig 1857–1920 Großjena) Date: late 19th–early 20th century Medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, red gouache, corrected with white. Partially incised for transfer. Strips added at top and at right Accession: 1979.674.1 On view in: Not on view
